intro: Fuirena canescens, commonly known as the hairy fuirena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its aesthetic appeal.
